Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles downloading and processing images with size limitations and compression capabilities.

Class Description: The Picture class is designed to download images from given URLs while enforcing size limits and compression thresholds. It uses cURL for HTTP requests and provides mechanisms to control download size and handle response data efficiently.

Attributes:
- compressLimit: [int] - The maximum size (in bytes) for downloaded content before compression is considered
- sizeLimit: [int] - The maximum dimension (in pixels) for the image width/height

Methods:
- downloadImage: [downloadImage]($url: string) -> string - Downloads an image from the specified URL while respecting size limits. Returns the image body content.
  - $url: The URL of the image to download
  - Returns: The binary content of the downloaded image

Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified URL or file path, with support for HTTP requests using fsockopen, including handling of proxy servers, authentication, and security checks.

Function Description: The function retrieves content from either a local file or a remote HTTP resource. For HTTP requests, it establishes a socket connection, sends a GET request with appropriate headers (including authentication if provided), reads the response, and extracts the content body. It includes security checks for trusted URIs and resource directories when operating within a Smarty template context.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string) Required. The URL or file path to fetch
  - 'assign': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign the content to
  - 'assign_headers': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign headers to
  - 'user': (string) Optional. Username for HTTP authentication
  - 'pass': (string) Optional. Password for HTTP authentication
  - 'proxy_host': (string) Optional. Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer) Optional. Proxy server port
- $template: The Smarty template object (used for security checks and variable assignment)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if no 'assign' parameter is provided
- Assigns the content to the specified template variable if 'assign' parameter is present
- Returns nothing if security checks fail or if there are errors in fetching the content
right_result:
<?php
function smarty_function_fetch($params, $template) {
    if (empty($params['file'])) {
        return;
    }

    $file = $params['file'];
    $assign = $params['assign'] ?? null;
    $assign_headers = $params['assign_headers'] ?? null;
    $user = $params['user'] ?? '';
    $pass = $params['pass'] ?? '';
    $proxy_host = $params['proxy_host'] ?? null;
    $proxy_port = $params['proxy_port'] ?? null;

    $content = null;
    $headers = [];

    if (preg_match('!^http://!i', $file)) {
        $url = parse_url($file);
        if (!$url || !isset($url['host'])) {
            return;
        }

        $host = $url['host'];
        $port = $url['port'] ?? 80;
        $path = $url['path'] ?? '/';
        if (isset($url['query'])) {
            $path .= '?' . $url['query'];
        }

        if ($template->security && !in_array($host, $template->trusted_hosts ?? [])) {
            return;
        }

        $connect_host = $proxy_host ?: $host;
        $connect_port = $proxy_port ?: $port;
        $request_path = $proxy_host ? $file : $path;

        $fp = @fsockopen($connect_host, $connect_port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$fp) {
            return;
        }

        $request = "GET $request_path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; PHP/" . PHP_VERSION . ")\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n";

        if ($user && $pass) {
            $auth = base64_encode("$user:$pass");
            $request .= "Authorization: Basic $auth\r\n";
        }

        $request .= "\r\n";

        fwrite($fp, $request);

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 128);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        [$header_str, $body] = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
        $headers = explode("\r\n", $header_str);
        $http_status = explode(' ', $headers[0]);
        $status_code = $http_status[1] ?? 0;

        if ($status_code != '200') {
            return;
        }

        $content = $body;
    } else {
        if ($template->security) {
            $trusted = false;
            $real_file = realpath($file);
            if ($real_file && !empty($template->trusted_dir)) {
                foreach ($template->trusted_dir as $dir) {
                    $real_dir = realpath($dir);
                    if ($real_dir && strpos($real_file, $real_dir) === 0) {
                        $trusted = true;
                        break;
                    }
                }
            }
            if (!$trusted) {
                return;
            }
        }

        if (!file_exists($file) || !is_readable($file)) {
            return;
        }

        $content = file_get_contents($file);
    }

    if ($assign_headers) {
        $template->assign($assign_headers, $headers);
    }

    if ($assign) {
        $template->assign($assign, $content);
    } else {
        return $content;
    }
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP/HTTPS communications using either socket-based connections (via fsockopen) or cURL, supporting both standard and persistent connections, with proper header and cookie management.

Class Description: The soap_transport_http class provides low-level HTTP transport capabilities for SOAP communications, supporting both socket and cURL implementations. It handles connection management, request/response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- url: string - The target URL for HTTP requests
- uri: string - The URI portion of the URL
- scheme: string - The protocol scheme (http/https)
- host: string - The target hostname
- port: string - The target port number
- path: string - The path portion of the URL
- request_method: string - HTTP method (default: POST)
- protocol_version: string - HTTP version (default: 1.0)
- outgoing_headers: array - Headers to be sent with the request
- incoming_headers: array - Headers received in the response
- outgoing_payload: string - Data to be sent in the request
- incoming_payload: string - Data received in the response
- persistentConnection: bool - Flag for persistent connections
- use_curl: bool - Flag to use cURL instead of sockets
- proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration if used

Methods:
- __construct(string $url, array $curl_options=null, bool $use_curl=false) -> void - Initializes the transport with target URL and options
- connect(int $connection_timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30) -> bool - Establishes connection to server
- send(string $data, int $timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30, array $cookies=null) -> mixed - Sends data and returns response
- sendRequest(string $data, array $cookies=null) -> bool - Sends the HTTP request with headers
- getResponse() -> string|bool - Reads and processes the server response
- setHeader(string $name, string $value) -> void - Adds a header to outgoing request
- setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value) -> void - Sets cURL option when using cURL
- parseCookie(string $cookie_str) -> array|bool - Parses Set-Cookie header into array

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when CURL extension is not available. The class should support both GET and POST methods, handle headers, cookies, timeouts, and allow configuration of various connection parameters.

Class Description: The Http class provides low-level HTTP client functionality using PHP's fsockopen function. It's designed as a fallback when CURL isn't available, offering stable performance for making HTTP requests. The class contains one static method that handles the complete HTTP request lifecycle from connection establishment to response processing.

Methods:

Method1: fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []) -> mixed - Performs an HTTP request using fsockopen
  Input Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL to request
    - $conf: array - Configuration options including:
      - limit: int - Maximum bytes to read (0 for unlimited)
      - post: mixed - POST data (array or string)
      - cookie: string - Cookie header content
      - ip: string - Force specific IP address
      - timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds
      - block: bool - Whether to use blocking mode
  Return Type: mixed - Returns the HTTP response body as string, or empty string on failure

The method follows these steps:
1. Parses the URL and merges configuration with defaults
2. Prepares appropriate HTTP request headers (GET/POST)
3. Establishes TCP connection using fsockopen
4. Sends the HTTP request
5. Reads and processes the response
6. Closes the connection and returns the response body

Task Description: Create a PHP function that retrieves content from a specified URL using low-level socket operations (fsockopen) rather than higher-level HTTP client libraries. The function should handle both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, manage connection timeouts, and properly process the HTTP response.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to the specified HTTP server, sends a GET request, reads the response (separating headers from body), and returns the content. It handles both HTTP and HTTPS connections with appropriate ports, includes basic error handling, and follows proper HTTP protocol for request/response cycles.

Input:
- $url (string): The URL to fetch content from (e.g., "http://example.com" or "https://example.com")
- &$data (string, passed by reference): Variable that will contain the response body content

Output:
- bool: Returns true if the request was successful and content was retrieved, false if any error occurred (connection failure, empty response, etc.)
- The response body content is stored in the $data parameter passed by reference

Note: The function does not return the content directly but instead modifies the $data parameter. This follows the pattern seen in the reference code where output is handled via parameter reference rather than return value.
right_result:
<?php
function fetchContent($url, &$data) {
    $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
    if (!$parsedUrl || !isset($parsedUrl['host'])) {
        return false;
    }

    $scheme = isset($parsedUrl['scheme']) ? strtolower($parsedUrl['scheme']) : 'http';
    $host = $parsedUrl['host'];
    $port = isset($parsedUrl['port']) ? $parsedUrl['port'] : ($scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);

    $defaultPort = $scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80;
    $hostHeader = $host;
    if ($port != $defaultPort) {
        $hostHeader .= ":$port";
    }

    $contextOptions = [];
    if ($scheme === 'https') {
        $contextOptions['ssl'] = ['verify_peer' => false, 'verify_peer_name' => false];
    }
    $context = stream_context_create($contextOptions);

    $hostToConnect = ($scheme === 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host;
    $fp = fsockopen($hostToConnect, $port, $errno, $errstr, 10, $context);
    if (!$fp) {
        return false;
    }

    stream_set_timeout($fp, 5);

    $path = isset($parsedUrl['path']) ? $parsedUrl['path'] : '/';
    $query = isset($parsedUrl['query']) ? '?' . $parsedUrl['query'] : '';
    $path .= $query;

    $request = "GET $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $hostHeader\r\n";
    $request .= "Connection: close\r\n";
    $request .= "\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $headers = [];
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $line = fgets($fp);
        if ($line === false) {
            fclose($fp);
            return false;
        }
        if (trim($line) === '') {
            break;
        }
        $headers[] = $line;
    }

    if (empty($headers)) {
        fclose($fp);
        return false;
    }

    $statusLine = array_shift($headers);
    preg_match('{^HTTP/\d\.\d (\d+)}', $statusLine, $matches);
    $statusCode = isset($matches[1]) ? (int)$matches[1] : 0;

    if ($statusCode < 200 || $statusCode >= 300) {
        fclose($fp);
        return false;
    }

    $data = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $data .= fread($fp, 8192);
    }

    fclose($fp);
    return $data !== '';
}
?>

Task Description: Implement a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when cURL is not available. The class should support both GET and POST requests with configurable options like timeout, cookies, and blocking mode.

    - $url: string - The target URL to request

Task Description: Implement a function that sends a delayed message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare a delayed exchange and queue, and publish a message with a specified delay time.

Function Description: The function `send_delayed_message` sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue with a specified delay. It uses a delayed exchange to achieve the delay functionality. The function handles the connection setup, exchange and queue declaration, message creation with delay headers, and cleanup of resources.

Input:
- `$message_content` [string] - The content of the message to be sent.
- `$delay_ms` [int] - The delay time in milliseconds before the message is delivered to the queue.

Output: None. The function does not return any value but publishes the message to the specified RabbitMQ queue with the given delay.

Note: The function assumes the existence of a `config.php` file containing the RabbitMQ connection parameters (HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST).
right_result:
<?php

require_once 'config.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function send_delayed_message($message_content, $delay_ms) {
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection(HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST);
    $channel = $connection->channel();

    $arguments = new \PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable(['x-delayed-type' => 'direct']);
    $channel->exchange_declare('delayed_exchange', 'x-delayed-message', false, true, false, false, false, $arguments);

    $channel->queue_declare('delayed_queue', false, true, false, false);

    $channel->queue_bind('delayed_queue', 'delayed_exchange', 'delayed_key');

    $msg = new AMQPMessage($message_content, ['headers' => ['x-delay' => $delay_ms]]);
    $channel->basic_publish($msg, 'delayed_exchange', 'delayed_key');

    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP function that sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue using the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should handle connection establishment, message publishing, and resource cleanup.

Function Description: The function `send_rabbitmq_message` sends a given message to a predefined RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the RabbitMQ server, declares the necessary exchange and queue, publishes the message, and then closes the connection. The function returns a boolean indicating success or failure.

Input:  
- `$message_content` (string): The content of the message to be sent to the RabbitMQ queue.

Output:  
- (bool): Returns `true` if the message was successfully sent, `false` if an error occurred.
right_result:
<?php

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function send_rabbitmq_message($message_content) {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $channel = $connection->channel();
        $channel->exchange_declare('my_exchange', 'direct', false, true, false);
        $channel->queue_declare('my_queue', false, true, false, false);
        $channel->queue_bind('my_queue', 'my_exchange', 'my_routing_key');
        $msg = new AMQPMessage($message_content);
        $channel->basic_publish($msg, 'my_exchange', 'my_routing_key');
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
        return true;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a Redis-based session handler class that extends a base session driver and implements the SessionHandlerInterface for use in a web application framework.

Class Description: The CI_Session_redis_driver class provides Redis-based session management functionality, including session data storage, retrieval, locking mechanisms, and cleanup. It handles connection management, session data persistence, and concurrency control through Redis operations.

Attributes:
- _redis: [Redis] - Instance of the Redis client used for all operations
- _key_prefix: [string] - Prefix for all Redis keys used in session storage
- _lock_key: [string] - Key used for the current session lock
- _key_exists: [bool] - Flag indicating whether the current session key exists in Redis
- _config: [array] - Configuration array containing connection parameters and settings
- _session_id: [string] - Current session ID being handled
- _fingerprint: [string] - MD5 hash of the current session data for change detection

Methods:
- __construct(&$params) -> [void] - Constructor that parses configuration parameters and sets up the Redis connection details
- open($save_path, $name) -> [bool] - Opens a connection to the Redis server using configured parameters
- read($session_id) -> [string] - Reads session data from Redis for the given session ID
- write($session_id, $session_data) -> [bool] - Writes session data to Redis for the given session ID
- close() -> [bool] - Closes the Redis connection and releases any locks
- destroy($session_id) -> [bool] - Removes session data from Redis for the given session ID
- gc($maxlifetime) -> [bool] - Garbage collection handler (not implemented for Redis)
- _get_lock($session_id) -> [bool] - Internal method to acquire a lock for session operations
- _release_lock() -> [bool] - Internal method to release the current session lock
- _fail() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation failures
- _success() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation successes
right_result:
<?php
class CI_Session_redis_driver implements SessionHandlerInterface {
    protected $_redis;
    protected $_key_prefix = 'ci_session:';
    protected $_lock_key;
    protected $_key_exists = false;
    protected $_config;
    protected $_session_id;
    protected $_fingerprint;

    public function __construct(&$params) {
        $this->_config = $params;
        $this->_key_prefix = isset($params['key_prefix']) ? $params['key_prefix'] : $this->_key_prefix;
    }

    public function open($save_path, $name) {
        $hostname = isset($this->_config['host']) ? $this->_config['host'] : '127.0.0.1';
        $port = isset($this->_config['port']) ? $this->_config['port'] : 6379;
        $timeout = isset($this->_config['timeout']) ? $this->_config['timeout'] : 0;
        $password = isset($this->_config['password']) ? $this->_config['password'] : null;
        $database = isset($this->_config['database']) ? $this->_config['database'] : 0;

        $this->_redis = new Redis();
        if (!$this->_redis->connect($hostname, $port, $timeout)) {
            return false;
        }

        if ($password && !$this->_redis->auth($password)) {
            return false;
        }

        if (!$this->_redis->select($database)) {
            return false;
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function read($session_id) {
        $this->_session_id = $session_id;
        $this->_lock_key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id . ':lock';

        if (!$this->_get_lock($session_id)) {
            return false;
        }

        $key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id;
        $data = $this->_redis->get($key);

        if ($data === false) {
            $this->_key_exists = false;
            return '';
        }

        $this->_key_exists = true;
        $this->_fingerprint = md5($data);
        return $data;
    }

    public function write($session_id, $session_data) {
        if (!$this->_redis || !$this->_session_id || $this->_session_id !== $session_id) {
            return false;
        }

        if ($this->_fingerprint && md5($session_data) === $this->_fingerprint) {
            return $this->_success();
        }

        $key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id;
        $max_lifetime = ini_get('session.gc_maxlifetime');

        if (!$this->_redis->setEx($key, $max_lifetime, $session_data)) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        $this->_key_exists = true;
        $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function close() {
        if ($this->_redis) {
            $this->_release_lock();
            $this->_redis->close();
        }
        return true;
    }

    public function destroy($session_id) {
        $key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id;
        if ($this->_redis->del($key) === false) {
            return false;
        }

        $this->_release_lock();
        return true;
    }

    public function gc($maxlifetime) {
        return true;
    }

    protected function _get_lock($session_id) {
        $lock_key = $this->_key_prefix . $session_id . ':lock';
        $attempt = 0;
        $max_attempts = 100;

        while ($attempt < $max_attempts) {
            if ($this->_redis->setNx($lock_key, time())) {
                $this->_redis->expire($lock_key, 300); // 5 minute timeout
                return true;
            }

            $lock_time = $this->_redis->get($lock_key);
            if ((time() - $lock_time) > 300) { // Lock expired
                $this->_redis->del($lock_key);
                continue;
            }

            usleep(100000); // Wait 0.1s before retrying
            $attempt++;
        }

        return false;
    }

    protected function _release_lock() {
        if ($this->_lock_key) {
            $this->_redis->del($this->_lock_key);
            $this->_lock_key = null;
        }
        return true;
    }

    protected function _fail() {
        return false;
    }

    protected function _success() {
        return true;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a Redis-based queue management system with connection handling, basic Redis operations, and error recovery mechanisms.

Class Description: The `queue` class is a Redis wrapper that manages connections to Redis servers and provides common Redis operations with automatic reconnection on failure. It supports multiple Redis connections, connection pooling, and prefixing of keys.

Attributes:
- `$redis`: [static, mixed] - Placeholder for Redis instance (deprecated in favor of `$links`)
- `$configs`: [static, array] - Stores configuration for different Redis connections
- `$links`: [static, array] - Maintains active Redis connections
- `$link_name`: [static, string] - Current connection name (defaults to 'default')
- `$prefix`: [static, string] - Default prefix for Redis keys
- `$error`: [static, string] - Stores the last error message

Methods:
- `init()` -> [bool|Redis] - Initializes Redis connection using current configuration. Returns Redis instance or false on failure.
- `set($key, $value, $expire = 0)` -> [bool|null] - Sets a key-value pair in Redis with optional expiration. Returns true on success, null on failure.
- `get($key)` -> [mixed|null] - Retrieves a value by key from Redis. Returns the value or null on failure.
- `del($key)` -> [int|null] - Deletes a key from Redis. Returns number of deleted keys or null on failure.
- `_get_default_config()` -> [array] - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings.
- `clear_link()` -> [void] - Closes all active Redis connections and clears the connection pool.

Input:
- Configuration via `$GLOBALS['config']['redis']` for default connection
- Method parameters as described above

Output:
- For connection methods: Redis instance or boolean
- For data operations: Various return types as described above
- Error messages stored in `$error` property

Task Description: Create a Redis cache driver class for CodeIgniter that implements basic cache operations using Redis as the backend storage.

Class Description: The CI_Cache_redis class extends CI_Driver and provides an interface for caching data in Redis. It handles connection management, serialization of complex data types, and standard cache operations like get, save, delete, increment, and decrement.

Task Description: Create a Redis wrapper class in PHP that provides a simplified interface for connecting to and interacting with a Redis server, including connection management, basic operations, and error handling.

Class Description: The cls_redis class is a singleton-style wrapper for PHP's Redis extension that manages Redis connections, provides common Redis operations, and handles connection errors gracefully. It supports multiple connection configurations, automatic reconnection on failure, and key prefixing.

Attributes:

Attribute1: protected static $redis - Redis - Singleton Redis instance (deprecated)
Attribute2: protected static $configs - array - Stores Redis connection configurations
Attribute3: private static $links - array - Maintains active Redis connections
Attribute4: private static $link_name - string - Current connection name (default 'default')
Attribute5: public static $prefix - string - Default key prefix ('phpspider')
Attribute6: public static $error - string - Stores last error message

Methods:

Method1: init() -> Redis|false - Initializes and returns a Redis connection instance
Method2: set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0) -> bool|null - Stores a value in Redis with optional expiration
Method3: get(string $key) -> mixed|null - Retrieves a value from Redis by key
Method4: clear_link() -> void - Closes all active Redis connections

<?php

class cls_redis {
    protected static $redis;
    protected static $configs = [];
    private static $links = [];
    private static $link_name = 'default';
    public static $prefix = 'phpspider';
    public static $error = '';

    public static function init() {
        if (isset(self::$links[self::$link_name])) {
            $redis = self::$links[self::$link_name];
            if ($redis->ping() === '+PONG') {
                return $redis;
            } else {
                unset(self::$links[self::$link_name]);
            }
        }

        $config = self::_get_default_config();
        $redis = new Redis();
        $connected = $redis->connect($config['host'], $config['port'], $config['timeout']);
        if (!$connected) {
            self::$error = 'Redis connect error: ' . $redis->getLastError();
            return false;
        }

        if (!empty($config['password'])) {
            if (!$redis->auth($config['password'])) {
                self::$error = 'Redis auth failed';
                return false;
            }
        }

        if ($config['database'] > 0) {
            $redis->select($config['database']);
        }

        if ($config['timeout'] > 0) {
            $redis->setOption(Redis::OPT_READ_TIMEOUT, $config['timeout']);
        }

        self::$links[self::$link_name] = $redis;
        self::$redis = $redis;
        return $redis;
    }

    public static function set(string $key, $value, int $expire = 0): ?bool {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) return null;
        $key = self::$prefix . '_' . $key;
        $value = serialize($value);
        if ($expire > 0) {
            $result = $redis->set($key, $value, $expire);
        } else {
            $result = $redis->set($key, $value);
        }
        if ($result === false) {
            self::$error = $redis->getLastError();
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public static function get(string $key): mixed {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) return null;
        $key = self::$prefix . '_' . $key;
        $value = $redis->get($key);
        if ($value === false) {
            return null;
        }
        return unserialize($value);
    }

    public static function clear_link(): void {
        foreach (self::$links as $link) {
            $link->close();
        }
        self::$links = [];
    }

    protected static function _get_default_config(): array {
        return [
            'host' => '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => 6379,
            'password' => '',
            'database' => 0,
            'timeout' => 30,
        ];
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The HttpClientKernel class is an implementation of HttpKernelInterface that provides HTTP client capabilities using Symfony's HTTP client components. It handles HTTP requests by sending them to a remote server and returning the response, supporting various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a default HttpClient instance. Throws an exception if the HttpClient component is not installed.
- handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request by sending it to the target server and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body preparation.
- getBody(Request $request) -> [?AbstractPart] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, a TextPart for raw content, or a FormDataPart for form data including file uploads. Throws an exception if the Mime component is not installed when needed.
- getHeaders(Request $request) -> [array] - Extracts and formats headers from the request object, including cookies, into an array suitable for the HTTP client.

<?php

namespace App\Http;

use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClientInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\HttpKernelInterface;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\AbstractPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\TextPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\FormDataPart;

class HttpClientKernel implements HttpKernelInterface
{
    private $client;

    public function __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        if (null === $client) {
            if (!class_exists(HttpClient::class)) {
                throw new \RuntimeException('Symfony HttpClient component is not installed.');
            }
            $this->client = HttpClient::create();
        } else {
            $this->client = $client;
        }
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $url = $request->getUri();

        $options = [
            'headers' => $this->getHeaders($request),
        ];

        if ($body = $this->getBody($request)) {
            $options['body'] = $body->bodyToIterable();
        }

        $response = $this->client->request($method, $url, $options);

        $headers = [];
        foreach ($response->getHeaders(false) as $name => $values) {
            $headers[$name] = implode(', ', $values);
        }

        return new Response(
            $response->getContent(),
            $response->getStatusCode(),
            $headers
        );
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): ?AbstractPart
    {
        if (\in_array($request->getMethod(), ['GET', 'HEAD'], true)) {
            return null;
        }

        $contentType = $request->headers->get('Content-Type');

        if (false !== strpos((string)$contentType, 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded') || 
            false !== strpos((string)$contentType, 'multipart/form-data')) {
            
            if (!class_exists(FormDataPart::class)) {
                throw new \RuntimeException('Symfony Mime component is required for form data handling.');
            }
            
            return new FormDataPart(
                $request->request->all(),
                $request->files->all()
            );
        }

        return new TextPart($request->getContent());
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = $request->headers->all();
        $cookies = [];

        foreach ($request->cookies as $name => $value) {
            $cookies[] = "$name=$value";
        }

        if (!empty($cookies)) {
            $headers['Cookie'] = [implode('; ', $cookies)];
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a basic TCP socket server capable of handling client connections, executing commands, and managing directory changes.

Function Description: The function starts a TCP socket server on a specified port, accepts client connections, and provides an interactive shell-like interface. It handles 'cd' commands for directory navigation, 'exit'/'quit' commands for termination, and executes other system commands. The server sends command outputs and current working directory information back to the client.

Input:
- $port: integer - The port number to bind the server socket to
- $wpxf_disabled: array - List of disabled functions/callables
- $wpxf_exec: callable - Function to execute system commands

Output: None (The function runs indefinitely until the client disconnects or sends an exit command)
right_result:
<?php
function tcpServer($port, $wpxf_disabled, $wpxf_exec) {
    $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
    socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, 1);
    socket_bind($socket, '0.0.0.0', $port);
    socket_listen($socket);
    $client = socket_accept($socket);
    while (true) {
        $cmd = socket_read($client, 1024);
        $cmd = trim($cmd);
        if (!$cmd) continue;
        $out = '';
        if ($cmd == 'exit' || $cmd == 'quit') {
            // Exit command, prepare to break loop after response
        } else if (strpos($cmd, 'cd ') === 0) {
            $dir = trim(substr($cmd, 3));
            if (empty($dir)) {
                $out = 'cd: usage: cd <directory>';
            } else {
                if (!@chdir($dir)) {
                    $out = 'cd: error: No such file or directory';
                }
            }
        } else {
            $out = $wpxf_exec($cmd);
        }
        $cwd = getcwd();
        socket_write($client, $cwd . "\n" . $out . "\n");
        if ($cmd == 'exit' || $cmd == 'quit') {
            break;
        }
    }
    socket_close($client);
    socket_close($socket);
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a JSON-RPC client using Swoole's coroutine-based TCP client for asynchronous communication with a JSON-RPC server. The class should handle connection management, request/response serialization, and middleware processing.

Class Description: The Connection class provides a JSON-RPC client implementation using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP communication. It manages the connection lifecycle, handles JSON-RPC protocol serialization/deserialization, and supports middleware processing for requests.

Attributes:
- host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the JSON-RPC server

<?php

use Swoole\Coroutine\Client;

class Connection
{
    private string $host;
    private int $port;
    private float $timeout;
    private float $callTimeout;
    private array $middleware;
    protected ?Client $client = null;

    public function __construct(array $config = [])
    {
        $this->host = $config['host'] ?? '127.0.0.1';
        $this->port = $config['port'] ?? 80;
        $this->timeout = $config['timeout'] ?? 5.0;
        $this->callTimeout = $config['call_timeout'] ?? 10.0;
        $this->middleware = $config['middleware'] ?? [];
    }

    public function connect(): void
    {
        if ($this->client instanceof Client && $this->client->isConnected()) {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Already connected");
        }
        $this->client = new Client(SWOOLE_SOCK_TCP);
        if (!$this->client->connect($this->host, $this->port, $this->timeout)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Connection failed: {$this->client->errCode}");
        }
    }

    public function call(Request $request): Response
    {
        $handler = function (Request $request) {
            $payload = json_encode([
                'jsonrpc' => '2.0',
                'method' => $request->getMethod(),
                'params' => $request->getParams(),
                'id' => $request->getId(),
            ]);
            $this->send($payload);
            $rawResponse = $this->recv($this->callTimeout);
            $decoded = json_decode($rawResponse, true);
            return new Response(
                $decoded['result'] ?? null,
                $decoded['error'] ?? null,
                $decoded['id'] ?? null
            );
        };

        foreach (array_reverse($this->middleware) as $middleware) {
            $handler = function (Request $request) use ($middleware, $handler) {
                return $middleware->process($request, $handler);
            };
        }

        return $handler($request);
    }

    public function close(): void
    {
        if ($this->client instanceof Client && $this->client->isConnected()) {
            $this->client->close();
            $this->client = null;
        }
    }

    protected function recv(float $timeout = -1): string
    {
        if (!$this->client instanceof Client || !$this->client->isConnected()) {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Client not connected");
        }
        $data = $this->client->recv($timeout);
        if ($data === false || $data === '') {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Failed to receive data: " . swoole_strerror(swoole_errno()));
        }
        return $data;
    }

    protected function send(string $data): void
    {
        if (!$this->client instanceof Client || !$this->client->isConnected()) {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Client not connected");
        }
        if ($this->client->send($data) === false) {
            throw new \RuntimeException("Failed to send data: " . swoole_strerror(swoole_errno()));
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a WebSocket server in PHP using stream_socket_server that handles client connections, processes requests, and sends responses.

Class Description: The Server class implements a WebSocket server that listens for incoming connections, handles client requests through callbacks, and manages socket communication. It supports non-blocking operations and provides hooks for custom logic.

Attributes:
- host: string - The host address to bind the server to
- port: int - The port number to listen on
- output: OutputInterface - Interface for debug and status output
- stop: bool - Flag to control server shutdown
- socket: resource - The main server socket resource
- clientSockets: array - Array of connected client sockets
- afterCallback: Closure - Callback executed after server starts
- tickerCallback: Closure - Periodic callback during server loop
- routerCallback: Closure - Request routing callback

Methods:
- __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) -> void - Initializes server with host, port and output interface
- checkRequiredExtensionsExists() -> void - Validates required PHP extensions are loaded
- run() -> void - Starts the server main loop

- updatePort() -> void - Updates the port number from actual socket binding
- acceptNewConnections() -> void - Accepts new client connections
- handleClientRequests() -> void - Processes requests from connected clients
- readClientRequest(resource $clientSocket) -> string - Reads complete request from client
- parseRequest(string $request) -> array - Parses request into path and payload
- sendResponse(resource $clientSocket, Response $response) -> void - Sends formatted response to client

<?php

interface OutputInterface {
    public function write(string $message);
}

class Response {
    private $status;
    private $headers = [];
    private $body = '';

    public function __construct(int $status = 200, array $headers = [], string $body = '') {
        $this->status = $status;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }

    public function getStatusCode() {
        return $this->status;
    }

    public function getReasonPhrase() {
        return 'OK';
    }

    public function getHeaders() {
        return $this->headers;
    }

    public function getBody() {
        return $this->body;
    }
}

class Server {
    private $host;
    private $port;
    private $output;
    private $stop = false;
    private $socket;
    private $clientSockets = [];
    private $afterCallback;
    private $tickerCallback;
    private $routerCallback;

    public function __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) {
        $this->host = $host;
        $this->port = $port;
        $this->output = $output;
    }

    private function checkRequiredExtensionsExists() {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new Exception('Sockets extension is required.');
        }
    }

    public function run() {
        $this->checkRequiredExtensionsExists();
        $this->socket = $this->createServerSocket();
        $this->updatePort();

        if ($this->afterCallback instanceof Closure) {
            ($this->afterCallback)();
        }

        $this->stop = false;
        while (!$this->stop) {
            $this->acceptNewConnections();
            $this->handleClientRequests();
            if ($this->tickerCallback instanceof Closure) {
                ($this->tickerCallback)();
            }
        }
    }

    private function createServerSocket() {
        $socket = stream_socket_server(
            "tcp://{$this->host}:{$this->port}",
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            STREAM_SERVER_BIND | STREAM_SERVER_LISTEN
        );
        if (!$socket) {
            throw new Exception("Failed to create socket: $errstr");
        }
        stream_socket_set_blocking($socket, false);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function updatePort() {
        $name = stream_socket_get_name($this->socket, false);
        if ($name && preg_match('/:(\d+)$/', $name, $matches)) {
            $this->port = (int)$matches[1];
        }
    }

    private function acceptNewConnections() {
        $client = @stream_socket_accept($this->socket, 0);
        if ($client) {
            stream_socket_set_blocking($client, false);
            $this->clientSockets[] = $client;
        }
    }

    private function handleClientRequests() {
        foreach ($this->clientSockets as $key => $client) {
            $meta = stream_get_meta_data($client);
            if ($meta['eof'] || !$meta['unread_bytes']) continue;

            $request = $this->readClientRequest($client);
            if (!$request) {
                $this->closeClientSocket($client, $key);
                continue;
            }

            $parsed = $this->parseRequest($request);
            [$path, $payload] = $parsed;
            $response = ($this->routerCallback)($path, $payload);
            $this->sendResponse($client, $response);
        }
    }

    private function readClientRequest($client) {
        $data = '';
        while (!feof($client)) {
            $buffer = fread($client, 8192);
            if ($buffer === false) break;
            $data .= $buffer;
            if (strpos($data, "\r\n\r\n") !== false) break;
        }
        return $data;
    }

    private function parseRequest($request) {
        $headers = [];
        $parts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $request, 2);
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $parts[0]);
        $requestLine = array_shift($lines);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                [$key, $value] = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[strtolower(trim($key))] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        $body = $parts[1] ?? '';
        $path = parse_url($requestLine, PHP_URL_PATH);
        return [$path, $body];
    }

    private function sendResponse($client, $response) {
        $status = $response->getStatusCode();
        fwrite($client, "HTTP/1.1 {$status} OK\r\n");
        foreach ($response->getHeaders() as $name => $value) {
            fwrite($client, "{$name}: {$value}\r\n");
        }
        fwrite($client, "\r\n");
        fwrite($client, $response->getBody());
    }

    private function closeClientSocket($client, $key) {
        fclose($client);
        unset($this->clientSockets[$key]);
    }

    public function afterRun(Closure $param) {
        $this->afterCallback = $param;
    }

    public function ticker(Closure $param) {
        $this->tickerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function router(Closure $param) {
        $this->routerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function stop() {
        $this->stop = true;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that generates an image from a DOT script using the Graphviz `dot` command-line tool through inter-process communication in PHP.

Function Description: The function takes a DOT script and an image type as input, executes the `dot` command with the specified type, and returns the generated image data. It handles the subprocess communication using pipes for stdin, stdout, and stderr, ensuring proper resource cleanup and error handling.

Input: 
- $dot_script: string - The DOT language script to be processed by Graphviz
- $type: string - The output image type (e.g., 'png', 'svg', 'jpg')

Output: 
- Returns: string - The binary data of the generated image
- On error: Prints error message to stderr and exits the program
right_result:
<?php
function generateImageFromDot($dot_script, $type) {
    $descriptors = array(
        0 => array('pipe', 'r'),
        1 => array('pipe', 'w'),
        2 => array('pipe', 'w')
    );
    $process = proc_open('dot -T' . $type, $descriptors, $pipes);
    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        fwrite(STDERR, "Failed to start Graphviz process\n");
        exit(1);
    }
    fwrite($pipes[0], $dot_script);
    fclose($pipes[0]);
    $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);
    $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);
    $exit_code = proc_close($process);
    if ($exit_code !== 0) {
        fwrite(STDERR, $stderr);
        exit(1);
    }
    return $stdout;
}

<?php

namespace App\HttpClient;

use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClientInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\HttpKernel\HttpKernelInterface;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\AbstractPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\TextPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\FormDataPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\DataPart;

class HttpClientKernel
{
    private HttpClientInterface $client;

    public function __construct(HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        $this->client = $client ?? HttpClient::create();
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $url = $request->getUri();

        $options = [
            'headers' => $this->getHeaders($request),
        ];

        $bodyPart = $this->getBody($request);
        if ($bodyPart instanceof AbstractPart) {
            $content = $bodyPart->getBody();
            if ($bodyPart instanceof FormDataPart) {
                $content = $bodyPart->toString();
                $contentType = $bodyPart->getPreparedHeaders()->getHeaderLine('Content-Type');
                if ($contentType) {
                    $options['headers']['Content-Type'] = $contentType;
                }
            }
            $options['body'] = $content;
        }

        $response = $this->client->request($method, $url, $options);

        return new Response(
            $response->getContent(),
            $response->getStatusCode(),
            $response->getHeaders()
        );
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): ?AbstractPart
    {
        if (in_array($request->getMethod(), ['GET', 'HEAD'], true)) {
            return null;
        }

        $contentType = $request->headers->get('Content-Type', '');

        if (0 === strpos($contentType, 'multipart/form-data')) {
            $formData = [];

            foreach ($request->request->all() as $key => $value) {
                $formData[$key] = $value;
            }

            foreach ($request->files->all() as $key => $file) {
                if ($file instanceof \Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\File\UploadedFile) {
                    $formData[$key] = new DataPart(
                        fopen($file->getRealPath(), 'r'),
                        $file->getClientOriginalName(),
                        $file->getClientMimeType()
                    );
                }
            }

            return new FormDataPart($formData);
        }

        return new TextPart($request->getContent());
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = [];

        $cookies = $request->cookies->all();
        if (!empty($cookies)) {
            $cookieHeader = '';
            foreach ($cookies as $name => $value) {
                $cookieHeader .= sprintf('%s=%s; ', $name, rawurlencode($value));
            }
            $headers['Cookie'] = rtrim($cookieHeader, '; ');
        }

        foreach ($request->headers->all() as $name => $values) {
            if (strtolower($name) === 'cookie') {
                continue;
            }
            $headers[$name] = implode(', ', $values);
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that facilitates the execution of shell commands as subprocesses, handling input/output streams, and providing process execution details.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr), return codes, and execution time. It includes methods for basic execution and error-checked execution variants.

Attributes:

command: [string] - The shell command to be executed
cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command execution
env: [array] - Environment variables for the command
descriptors: [array] - Static array defining I/O streams configuration
log_run_times: [bool] - Static flag to enable execution time logging
run_times: [array] - Static array storing command execution time statistics

Methods:

create: [static](string $command, string|null $cwd = null, array $env = []) -> [Process] - Factory method to create a new Process instance
run: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and returns execution details including stdout, stderr, and return code
run_check: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero
run_check_stderr: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or if stderr contains unexpected output (with specific exception for known PSR-0 deprecation warning)
right_result:
<?php

class Process {
    private static $descriptors = [
        ['pipe', 'r'],
        ['pipe', 'w'],
        ['pipe', 'w'],
    ];

    private static $log_run_times = false;
    private static $run_times = [];

    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $env;

    public function __construct(string $command, string $cwd = null, array $env = []) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public static function create(string $command, string $cwd = null, array $env = []): Process {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function run(): ProcessRun {
        $startTime = microtime(true);

        $process = proc_open(
            $this->command,
            self::$descriptors,
            $pipes,
            $this->cwd,
            $this->env
        );

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to start process');
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);

        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);

        fclose($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $returnCode = proc_close($process);

        $duration = microtime(true) - $startTime;

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = [
                'command' => $this->command,
                'duration' => $duration,
            ];
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $returnCode, $duration, $this->command);
    }

    public function run_check(): ProcessRun {
        $run = $this->run();
        if ($run->getReturnCode() !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException(sprintf(
                'Command "%s" failed with return code %d',
                $this->command,
                $run->getReturnCode()
            ));
        }
        return $run;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr(): ProcessRun {
        $run = $this->run();
        if ($run->getReturnCode() !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException(sprintf(
                'Command "%s" failed with return code %d',
                $this->command,
                $run->getReturnCode()
            ));
        }

        $stderr = $run->getStderr();
        if (trim($stderr) !== '' && strpos($stderr, 'Deprecated: Class PSR0_') === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException(sprintf(
                'Unexpected stderr output for command "%s": %s',
                $this->command,
                $stderr
            ));
        }

        return $run;
    }
}

class ProcessRun {
    private $stdout;
    private $stderr;
    private $returnCode;
    private $duration;
    private $command;

    public function __construct(string $stdout, string $stderr, int $returnCode, float $duration, string $command) {
        $this->stdout = $stdout;
        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->returnCode = $returnCode;
        $this->duration = $duration;
        $this->command = $command;
    }

    public function getStdout(): string {
        return $this->stdout;
    }

    public function getStderr(): string {
        return $this->stderr;
    }

    public function getReturnCode(): int {
        return $this->returnCode;
    }

    public function getDuration(): float {
        return $this->duration;
    }

    public function getCommand(): string {
        return $this->command;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and JSON response handling.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it based on input parameters, execute the request, handle errors, process the response, and return a structured result including status, headers, and response body. It should support GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS methods, with options for custom headers, additional cURL options, JSON response parsing, and timeout configuration.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $method (string, optional, default='GET'): HTTP method (GET|POST|PUT|DELETE|PATCH|OPTIONS)
- $data (mixed, optional, default=false): Request payload data
- $headers (mixed, optional, default=false): Request headers (string or array)
- $options (mixed, optional, default=false): Additional cURL options as array
- $json (bool, optional, default=false): Whether to parse response as JSON
- $timeout (int, optional, default=3600): Request timeout in seconds

Output:
Returns an associative array containing:
- 'data': Response body (parsed as array if $json=true and valid JSON)
- 'status': Boolean indicating success (HTTP status 200-299)
- 'code': HTTP status code
- 'header': Parsed response headers as associative array

In case of cURL errors:
- 'data': Error message
- 'code': 0
- 'header': cURL info array
right_result:
<?php
function curlRequest($url, $method = 'GET', $data = false, $headers = false, $options = false, $json = false, $timeout = 3600) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt_array($ch, [
        CURLOPT_URL            => $url,
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_HEADER         => true,
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT        => $timeout
    ]);

    switch (strtoupper($method)) {
        case 'POST':
            curl_setopt_array($ch, [
                CURLOPT_POST       => true,
                CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => $data
            ]);
            break;
        case 'PUT':
        case 'DELETE':
        case 'PATCH':
        case 'OPTIONS':
            curl_setopt_array($ch, [
                CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $method,
                CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS    => $data
            ]);
            break;
        case 'GET':
        default:
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPGET, true);
    }

    if ($headers) {
        $curlHeaders = is_array($headers) ? [] : [$headers];
        if (is_array($headers)) {
            foreach ($headers as $key => $value) {
                $curlHeaders[] = is_int($key) ? $value : "$key: $value";
            }
        }
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $curlHeaders);
    }

    if (is_array($options)) {
        foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
        }
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($response === false) {
        $result = [
            'data'   => curl_error($ch),
            'code'   => 0,
            'header' => curl_getinfo($ch),
            'status' => false
        ];
        curl_close($ch);
        return $result;
    }

    $headerSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
    $rawHeaders = substr($response, 0, $headerSize);
    $body       = substr($response, $headerSize);
    $httpCode   = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    curl_close($ch);

    $headersArray = [];
    foreach (explode("\r\n", $rawHeaders) as $line) {
        if (trim($line) === '' || strpos($line, ':') === false) continue;
        list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
        $headersArray[trim($name)] = trim($value);
    }

    if ($json) {
        $decoded = json_decode($body, true);
        if (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            $body = $decoded;
        }
    }

    return [
        'data'   => $body,
        'status' => $httpCode >= 200 && $httpCode <= 299,
        'code'   => $httpCode,
        'header' => $headersArray
    ];
}
?>

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL for sending upgrade notifications, with error handling and response processing capabilities.

Class Description: UpgradeNoticeBehavior is a class designed to manage HTTP communications for upgrade notifications. It encapsulates cURL functionality to send requests to specified URLs, handle parameters and headers, process responses, and manage errors.

Attributes:
header_: [string] - Stores HTTP headers for requests
httpCode_: [int] - Stores HTTP status code from responses
httpDesc_: [string] - Stores HTTP status description from responses
accesskey_: [string] - Stores access key for authentication
secretkey_: [string] - Stores secret key for authentication

Methods:
send: [send]([string $url, array $params = array(), array $headers = array()]) -> [mixed] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional parameters and headers. Returns the decoded JSON response on success or false on failure. Handles cURL errors and invalid response formats.
right_result:
<?php
class UpgradeNoticeBehavior {
    private $header_;
    private $httpCode_;
    private $httpDesc_;
    private $accesskey_;
    private $secretkey_;

    public function send($url, array $params = [], array $headers = []) {
        $ch = curl_init();

        $allHeaders = $this->header_ ? explode("\n", $this->header_) : [];
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            $allHeaders[] = $header;
        }

        $auth = base64_encode("{$this->accesskey_}:{$this->secretkey_}");
        array_unshift($allHeaders, "Authorization: Basic {$auth}");

        curl_setopt_array($ch, [
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER     => $allHeaders,
            CURLOPT_URL            => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HEADER         => false,
            CURLOPT_POST           => !empty($params),
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS     => http_build_query($params),
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $curlErrno = curl_errno($ch);
        $curlError = curl_error($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        $this->httpCode_ = $httpCode;
        $this->httpDesc_ = self::getHttpDescription($httpCode);

        if ($curlErrno !== 0) {
            $this->httpDesc_ = $curlError;
            return false;
        }

        $decoded = json_decode($response, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            return false;
        }

        return $decoded;
    }

    private static function getHttpDescription($code) {
        $codes = [
            100 => 'Continue',
            101 => 'Switching Protocols',
            200 => 'OK',
            201 => 'Created',
            202 => 'Accepted',
            203 => 'Non-Authoritative Information',
            204 => 'No Content',
            205 => 'Reset Content',
            206 => 'Partial Content',
            300 => 'Multiple Choices',
            301 => 'Moved Permanently',
            302 => 'Found',
            303 => 'See Other',
            304 => 'Not Modified',
            305 => 'Use Proxy',
            307 => 'Temporary Redirect',
            400 => 'Bad Request',
            401 => 'Unauthorized',
            402 => 'Payment Required',
            403 => 'Forbidden',
            404 => 'Not Found',
            405 => 'Method Not Allowed',
            406 => 'Not Acceptable',
            407 => 'Proxy Authentication Required',
            408 => 'Request Timeout',
            409 => 'Conflict',
            410 => 'Gone',
            411 => 'Length Required',
            412 => 'Precondition Failed',
            413 => 'Payload Too Large',
            414 => 'URI Too Long',
            415 => 'Unsupported Media Type',
            416 => 'Range Not Satisfiable',
            417 => 'Expectation Failed',
            428 => 'Precondition Required',
            429 => 'Too Many Requests',
            431 => 'Request Header Fields Too Large',
            500 => 'Internal Server Error',
            501 => 'Not Implemented',
            502 => 'Bad Gateway',
            503 => 'Service Unavailable',
            504 => 'Gateway Timeout',
            505 => 'HTTP Version Not Supported',
            511 => 'Network Authentication Required'
        ];
        return $codes[$code] ?? 'Unknown Status Code';
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with support for custom headers, payloads, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The Meting class provides functionality to make HTTP requests using PHP's cURL library. It supports GET/POST requests, custom headers, timeout settings, retry mechanism, and proxy configuration.

Attributes:
- header: array - Stores HTTP headers to be sent with the request
- proxy: string - Stores proxy server address if configured
- raw: mixed - Stores the raw response from the cURL request
- info: array - Stores cURL request information
- error: int - Stores cURL error code if any
- status: string - Stores cURL error message if any

Methods:
- curl(string $url, mixed $payload = null, int $headerOnly = 0) -> self - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional payload and header-only response flag. Returns the class instance for method chaining.
  Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL for the request
    - $payload: mixed - Optional request payload (array or string)
    - $headerOnly: int - Flag to return only headers (1) or full response (0)
right_result:
<?php

class Meting {
    private $header = [];
    private $proxy = '';
    public $raw;
    public $info = [];
    public $error = 0;
    public $status = '';

    public function curl(string $url, $payload = null, int $headerOnly = 0): self {
        $maxRetries = 3;
        $response = false;

        for ($i = 0; $i < $maxRetries; $i++) {
            $ch = curl_init();
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, $headerOnly ? true : false);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_NOBODY, $headerOnly);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 10);

            if (!empty($this->proxy)) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy);
            }

            if (!empty($this->header)) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $this->header);
            }

            if ($payload !== null) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
                if (is_array($payload)) {
                    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($payload));
                } else {
                    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $payload);
                }
            }

            $response = curl_exec($ch);
            $errno = curl_errno($ch);
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            $info = curl_getinfo($ch);

            curl_close($ch);

            if ($response !== false) {
                break;
            }

            if ($i < $maxRetries - 1) {
                usleep(500000);
            }
        }

        $this->raw = $response;
        $this->info = $info;
        $this->error = $errno;
        $this->status = $error;

        return $this;
    }
}

Methods:

Method1: getCurl(string $url) -> mixed - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and returns the response data. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method2: postDownloadCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, returns the response as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method3: postCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, decrypts the response using Faveo private key, and returns it as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Note: All methods include error handling that returns error messages to the caller when exceptions occur. Each method follows proper cURL resource management by initializing, executing, and closing the cURL session.

<?php

class HttpClient
{
    public function getCurl(string $url)
    {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new \Exception('cURL is not enabled.');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, [
            CURLOPT_URL            => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new \Exception("cURL error: $error");
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function postDownloadCurl(string $url, $data): array
    {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new \Exception('cURL is not enabled.');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, [
            CURLOPT_URL            => $url,
            CURLOPT_POST           => true,
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS     => http_build_query($data),
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER     => ['Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded'],
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new \Exception("cURL error: $error");
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        $decoded = json_decode($response, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            throw new \Exception("JSON decode error: " . json_last_error_msg());
        }

        return $decoded;
    }

    public function postCurl(string $url, $data): array
    {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new \Exception('cURL is not enabled.');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, [
            CURLOPT_URL            => $url,
            CURLOPT_POST           => true,
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS     => http_build_query($data),
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER     => ['Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded'],
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new \Exception("cURL error: $error");
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        // Example decryption logic - adjust according to actual Faveo private key implementation
        $privateKey = openssl_pkey_get_private(file_get_contents(__DIR__ . '/faveo_private.key'));
        $decrypted = '';
        if (!openssl_private_decrypt($response, $decrypted, $privateKey)) {
            $error = openssl_error_string();
            openssl_free_key($privateKey);
            throw new \Exception("Decryption error: $error");
        }
        openssl_free_key($privateKey);

        $decoded = json_decode($decrypted, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            throw new \Exception("JSON decode error: " . json_last_error_msg());
        }

        return $decoded;
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with Alipay's API to query fund transfer orders, including request signing and HTTP communication functionality.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides methods to interact with Alipay's payment API, specifically for querying fund transfer orders. It handles request signing, parameter encoding, and HTTP communication using cURL.

Attributes:
- appId: string - The application ID provided by Alipay
- rsaPrivateKey: string - The RSA private key for request signing
- charset: string - The character encoding to use (default: 'utf-8')

Methods:
- __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Initializes the service with Alipay app ID and private key
- doQuery(string $outBizBo='', string $orderId='') -> array - Queries a fund transfer order using either out business number or order ID
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Generates a signature for the request parameters
- sign(string $data, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Signs the given data using the configured private key
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty or null
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares the parameter string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Converts character encoding if needed
- curlPost(string $url='', mixed $postData='', array $options=[]) -> string - Executes a POST request using cURL
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    private $appId;
    private $rsaPrivateKey;
    private $charset;

    public function __construct($appid, $rsaPrivateKey, $charset = 'utf-8') {
        $this->appId = $appid;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
        $this->charset = $charset;
    }

    public function doQuery($outBizBo = '', $orderId = '') {
        if ($this->checkEmpty($outBizBo) && $this->checkEmpty($orderId)) {
            throw new Exception("outBizBo and orderId are empty");
        }

        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.order.query',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
        ];

        if (!$this->checkEmpty($outBizBo)) {
            $params['out_biz_no'] = $outBizBo;
        } else {
            $params['order_id'] = $orderId;
        }

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params);

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $response = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function generateSign($params, $signType = 'RSA') {
        $signContent = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($signContent, $signType);
    }

    public function sign($data, $signType = 'RSA') {
        if ($signType === 'RSA') {
            $privateKey = openssl_pkey_get_private($this->rsaPrivateKey);
            openssl_sign($data, $signature, $privateKey, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
            openssl_free_key($privateKey);
            return base64_encode($signature);
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function checkEmpty($value) {
        return empty($value);
    }

    public function getSignContent($params) {
        $stringToSign = [];
        ksort($params);
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if (isset($v) && $v !== '' && $k != 'sign' && $k != 'sign_type') {
                $stringToSign[] = $k . '=' . $v;
            }
        }
        return implode('&', $stringToSign);
    }

    public function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data) && $this->charset != $targetCharset) {
            return mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $this->charset);
        }
        return $data;
    }

    public function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = []) {
        if (is_array($postData)) {
            $postData = http_build_query($postData);
        }
        $defaults = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_POST => true,
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => $postData,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => false,
        ];
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, $defaults + $options);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception(curl_error($ch), curl_errno($ch));
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with file writing capabilities, including error handling and response status checking.

Class Description: The timthumb class provides functionality to fetch remote URLs using cURL with controlled file writing, including size limitations and error handling. It falls back to file_get_contents if cURL is not available.

Attributes:
- $curlFH: [resource|false] - File handle for writing cURL response data
- $curlDataWritten: [int] - Tracks the amount of data written during cURL transfer
- $lastURLError: [string|false] - Stores the last URL fetch error message

Methods:
- curlWrite($h, $d) -> [int] - Static callback function for cURL write operation that writes data to file and enforces size limits
  - $h: [resource] - cURL handle
  - $d: [string] - Data to write
  - Returns: [int] - Number of bytes written (0 if size limit exceeded)

- getURL($url, $tempfile) -> [bool] - Fetches content from a URL and saves it to a temporary file
  - $url: [string] - URL to fetch
  - $tempfile: [string] - Path to temporary file for storing the response
  - Returns: [bool] - True on success, False on failure
  - Side effects: Sets $lastURLError on failure, may call set404() or error() methods
right_result:
<?php
class timthumb {
    private static $curlFH;
    private static $curlDataWritten;
    public $lastURLError = false;
    const MAX_FILE_SIZE = 1048576;

    public static function curlWrite($h, $d) {
        $bytesToWrite = strlen($d);
        if (self::$curlDataWritten + $bytesToWrite > self::MAX_FILE_SIZE) {
            return 0;
        }
        $bytesWritten = fwrite(self::$curlFH, $d);
        if ($bytesWritten === false) {
            return 0;
        }
        self::$curlDataWritten += $bytesWritten;
        return $bytesWritten;
    }

    public function getURL($url, $tempfile) {
        $fh = fopen($tempfile, 'wb');
        if (!$fh) {
            $this->lastURLError = 'Failed to open temp file';
            return false;
        }

        self::$curlFH = $fh;
        self::$curlDataWritten = 0;

        if (function_exists('curl_init')) {
            $ch = curl_init();
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, ['timthumb', 'curlWrite']);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 0);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
            $success = curl_exec($ch);
            $errno = curl_errno($ch);
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
            curl_close($ch);
            fclose(self::$curlFH);
            self::$curlFH = null;

            if ($errno !== 0) {
                $this->lastURLError = $error;
                return false;
            }

            if ($httpCode >= 400) {
                $this->lastURLError = 'HTTP error ' . $httpCode;
                return false;
            }

            return true;
        } else {
            $data = @file_get_contents($url);
            if ($data === false) {
                $this->lastURLError = 'file_get_contents failed';
                fclose($fh);
                return false;
            }

            if (strlen($data) > self::MAX_FILE_SIZE) {
                $this->lastURLError = 'File size exceeds limit';
                fclose($fh);
                return false;
            }

            $bytesWritten = fwrite($fh, $data);
            fclose($fh);

            if ($bytesWritten !== strlen($data)) {
                $this->lastURLError = 'Failed to write data to file';
                return false;
            }

            return true;
        }
    }
}
?>

<?php
function makeCurlRequest($encUrl, $proxy = null, $proxyAuth = null) {
    $ch = curl_init($encUrl);
    curl_setopt_array($ch, [
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
        CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 10,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => 2,
    ]);
    
    if ($proxy !== null) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $proxy);
        if ($proxyAuth !== null && isset($proxyAuth['user'], $proxyAuth['pwd'])) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $proxyAuth['user'] . ':' . $proxyAuth['pwd']);
        }
    }
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($response === false) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return null;
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}
?>
